title: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
summary: CISA has added two new vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog , based on evidence of active exploitation. CVE(s) GitLab Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability CVE(s) Dell RecoverPoint for Virtual Machines (RP4VMs) Use of Hard-coded Credentials Vulnerability These types of vulnerabilities are frequent attack vectors for malicious cyber actors and pose significant risks to the federal enterprise.
